Sentencas: Low-cost semiconductors have emerged as potential electrolyte materials for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFC).
Titulo: Structural and electrical properties of M-doped TiO2 (M = Ni, Cu, Zn) relevant to their application as electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The present work describes the synthesis and characterization of Ti0.95M0.05O2-delta = Ni, Cu, Zn) followed by the determination of ionic conductivity using a.c. impedance technique.
Titulo: Structural and electrical properties of M-doped TiO2 (M = Ni, Cu, Zn) relevant to their application as electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The formation of the solid solution was confirmed by XRD, Raman, FTIR, DR-UV-Vis, PL, BET, FE-SEM, and EDX.
Titulo: Structural and electrical properties of M-doped TiO2 (M = Ni, Cu, Zn) relevant to their application as electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The obtained ionic conductivities (in S cm(-1)) for TiO2 (1.92 x 10(-5)), Ti0.95M0.05O2-delta (2.78 x 10(-5)), Ti0.95M0.05O2-delta (2.16 x 10(-5)) at 973 K and for Ti0.95Cu0.05O2-delta (2.39 x 10(-3)) at 1023 K are comparable to commercially available YSZ operating at high temperature and doped ceria electrolytes.
Titulo: Structural and electrical properties of M-doped TiO2 (M = Ni, Cu, Zn) relevant to their application as electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The ionic conductivities were found to increase linearly in the temperature range of 673-1023 K.
Titulo: Structural and electrical properties of M-doped TiO2 (M = Ni, Cu, Zn) relevant to their application as electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The lower activation energy of 1.08, 1.41, and 1.17 eV was obtained for TiO2, Ti0.95M0.05O2-delta, and Ti0.95M0.05O2-delta, respectively.
Titulo: Structural and electrical properties of M-doped TiO2 (M = Ni, Cu, Zn) relevant to their application as electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Thus, low-cost Ni, Cu, Zn-doped TiO2 solid solutions may be regarded as plausible electrolyte materials for SOFCs.
Titulo: Structural and electrical properties of M-doped TiO2 (M = Ni, Cu, Zn) relevant to their application as electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells
